review_title: Wish website wasn't shut down, but still
one_reviews_text: I'm sad that I can't browse other people's art online, was a way I learned to do more on tilt brush. But this is still my fave drawing ap. Just so much fun to draw in this program. I feel like a wizard drawing with light.

Is a very important missing feature. To draw over face, body, teapot, etc.
Maybe there are some difficulties finding closest surface, but it can be fixed using Octree or SDF.
I am a 3d and game dev. I can help, if you need.

review_title: Google needs to not cancel Google Poly!!
one_reviews_text:
Since Google has to be stupid, and cancel Google Poly, and SketchFab isn't working with Tilt Brush, Google needs to create a place for Artists to share their Tilt Brush Art. Otherwise Tilt Brush has become Pointless. 
I am so angry with Google for canceling Google Poly! Google is making stupid choices lately! 😡😡😡
Google should re check about closing Google poly.Tilt Brush become pointless

I accidentally switched into it and now I don't know how to get back out of it. It must have been a gesture/button combo or something.

I'm missing a feature that quill has, which is to be able to to import equirectangular images for reference. Also, I think it would be important to be able to nudge things around. When you're sculpting, and your sculpture consists of hundreds of strokes, it becomes rather impossible to fix proportions later. Indeed, painting with multiple people at the same time would be wonderful! Definitely more exporting options are needed (a lot more!) And a few more realistic brushes. It would also be really cool if we could turn 3d models into guides so that we can essentially paint them and then delete the model underneath.

I love that you can color pick from a reference photo! 

But devs, I would argue that there's a use case for using VR to make 2D painting engines more intuitive to use than tablets. You know.. with blending and water colors and such. It doesn't HAVE to be a 3D painting.

Its an awesome program for sculptuers! I cant get enought of it. The only thing that I am not a fan of is that you cant join 2 sketches togheter or more, wich sucks, because I am planning to create a huge scene, and my sculptures are in different files. If they would fix that problem, I would have gladly given theme a 5/5, if not for that hickup. And I'm sure that i am not the only one with that problem.

I cannot get past the Start Drawing. With the Tilt Brush and everything else you see at the start. The 2 wands glow with a white light going around the button part and the fire and grab. I can paint till I stop. But if I can start with a blank image !
UPDATE___________________________________________________________________________
I was able to get it to work, I Factory Reset My Quest and Reset my system also, that did it. Don't know if they will make a fix for it or not.
Now I finally get to draw ! That made my early weekend  !
Doesn't matter if you're an artist or not, just get it.  Unlock your inner creativity with this amazing tool.  I bought into VR after trying this out a trade show.

I was thinking I might work a quick sculpt to later export as STL or OBJ. Unfortunately this program appears to be more a toy than a design platform. Good for kids or someone that just likes being creative, but impractical for more professional applications.

This is an amazing art program. Its fantastic brushes and 3D makes it really satnd out. If there are layers in this program then I haven't found them. Without layers it's quite difficult to do seperate things without getting clunky. Other than that, It's a true show of technology at its finest.
Made just for right handed people. As a lefty I found this app quite annoying. It's like trying to write with left hand if you're right handed. What a waste of money.

Stock sketches load behind me, forcing me to back up and try to get it in front of me. Is there any way I can tweak it so the sketch loads in front of me? I have no idea of why it does this. Thanks in advance.

Otherwise, this is an amazing app.  I have no problem in giving it 5 stars.

review_title: I want a mode to made obj
one_reviews_text: I want to use tilt brush to make 3D models. I don't want to relearn on a other 3D modeling tool. Please help me.

Definitely worth the $20 I paid for this. The amount of brush types you have and things you can create/design seems enless. If you've watched the trailor for this, the VR space looks EVEN BETTER. Even if you dont feel you're creative or lack it, you'll realize you can do more than you thought when you jump in!
I did not find how to switch to left handed mode ?

It lacks the precision needed to be a serious tool but it works well enough to be very compelling. I wish there was a better way to see other's work and to navigate through those pieces. The artist should be able to set predetermined camera angles for their viewers too.
An awesome VR drawing tool, and it's a great first experience to introduce someone to VR.

You are only limited by your imagination. I use Photoshop and Illustrator as the main tools at my job for the past 20 years (google my user name) and Tilt Brush is a dream come true! I do get a good chuckle from reading the reviews that complain about no layers. You are drawing in 3D! you don't need layers, space is the "layers" LOL! Plus if you really need layers, just draw your object off to the side and then grab it and place it where needed. Layers, ha ha!

So ~ when I went to make an account, tiltbrush was wanting access to manage my youtube channel. Not happening, so I get to save NONE of my work now? Unless I grant you access you have no business requesting?!?!
Super quality experience and great app, but just too many "bling" brushes and too few useful ones. But fun to play with once in a while.
One of my favorite apps, and I have never like paint on the PC or been an atisticly creative person. This app changed everything!
Tiltbrush is the most fun ive had in VR. Not really a painter but honestly the app tends to grow on you as you get into more features. Also, the new update is sexy af. Kudos team!

I dont unterstand much of painting, but drawing and painting in a 3D space is just straight up fun! You can also download other peoples drawings and props to view/edit them.. I like the style of the App and it just shines of high quality development. I recommend giving this game a shot!

review_title: can no longer use models i make
one_reviews_text: I dont understand why it is no longer possible for me to download the models I make using other programs. Before I could simply put them in the correct file and then pull them up in app. little to no effort required. now it appears that google has decided to force me to put my work on one of their publishing sites. otherwise I cant use any of my models. WTF!!someone please tell me that there is a way around this. I have no desire to upload any of my work onto the site provided. I dont want my work published or shared. and I dont want it to be uploaded anywhere other than onto my personal computer.I swear it feels like google is hell bent on taking ownership of every aspect of our lives.this new change where I have to use a third party site to upload my own work so I can use it has made google tilt brush completely useless and unappealing for me. all the models i made previously are now useless, because they will no longer show up on my list in app.I consider this change in the way models are uploaded to be a shameless attempt by google to invade my most sacred private space. my mind. Why couldnt you just leave it the way it was before?I should not be required to share my models and essentially allow google or anyone else to steal me creative work just so I can load a model onto your app. I am deleting this app from my computer and will never purchase or use any google art app again. This is the final straw for me. I would also like my money back.good god its like you guys are offended by the very idea of privacy.

you should be able to anait using this and it would make its way better 


sorry can not spell to day

Tilt is an amateurish painting tool. It´s very intuitive and there are many types of very interesting brushes, which allows to paint colorful and impresive images, including some that glow with your own music. In a way, it allows to paint drawings that can be enjoyed while painting and afterwards. However, it can´t be used to paint in a more serious and complex way, since it doesn´t allow painting in different layers, plus, drawings can only be rotated in 2D.
tHe OcUlUs StOrE iS a ScAmMiNg MoNeY vAcUuM.
I bought the app and just cannot install into PC. Try to click many times on the install button, it doesnt work

Tilt Brush is a masterpiece. This is not a game : this is an art software, where you can draw/paint in the virtual space. Basically it's a "Photoshop in VR" (though both softwares are actually quite different). Not only the concept is unique (try to draw in thin air out of VR...), Tilt Brush also offers a lot of tools (especially compared to its opponents like Oculus Quill). I would say we have about 30 different brushes (from simple markers to beautiful visual effects like fire, ember, stars, hyper color, light pen, and many more!!!), plus a color change (obviously), plus some geometric guides (to draw perfect cubes or spheres for example), plus some export systems like the share system, or a camera (you can take pictures or video of your scenes). Besides, the graphics are gorgeous! Google apps have the best light effects in VR so far. The only thing missing is a virtual keyboard to type the names of the files (all my files are called "UntitledXX"...), and a multiplayer support (how fun it could be to draw with friends in real time!!!). Otherwise, Tilt Brush is perfect, because not only it is gorgeous, it also offers a lot of tools, with which we can do plenty of things as long as we are creative enough (which is not really my case, lol).

I can't comment on how professional this is or isn't - I'm not looking to create masterpieces here. But as a VR app that blows your mind with some super intuitive controls and very powerful rendering this is a must-have experience. Do yourself a favor and check out the 'Sketchbook' and see some truly mind blowing community creations. The kids really love this one, especially doing fashion design on the dress torso.
A very fun way to get into drawing in VR. Can be used by professional and amateur alike. Surpisingly wide range of tools.

If you want to show the potential of VR to a non-gamer, this is the piece. Anyone from your grandma to little brother will be able to grasp the consept and enjoy. No motion sickness and easy access for newbies. Also it's great at traditional pictionnary-type partygames. Just a free tip.
Yet another example of why VR/AR will change the world we know. Drawing in 3D is something that can only be experienced not described.
Kids going to love this one. (_-_)+(_x_)=?N

review_title: Modern day shrooms, without the comedown
one_reviews_text: Superb, play your music and paint with sound activated brushes, in real time, then wander around and record it, great meditation after a hard day of work.
The one you want to show to your family and friends.

After having the benefit of trying Medium, Quill and most recently, Tilt Brush, it's difficult to say which is best. In fact, I don't see how you can compare them. All three have their own appeal, in their own unique way. Medium, for a start, is more about sculpting, since it's a bit like working with clay. Whereas Quill and Tilt Brush is more like working with ink. That said, they both approach it in slightly different ways. Tilt Brush seems to focus more on drawing with effects, like drawing a line on fire, with smoke or snowflakes constantly falling. Quill has a limited choice in comparison and hardly no effects like Tilt Brush. The only thing I didn't like about Tilt Brush is the exclusion of an ability to use layers. Layers form a part of Medium and Quill's features and I find it more of a necessity over a luxury, especially nowadays since it's a ubiquitous feature. Apart from that, I love all three for simply doing their own thing and enjoy using them equally. I find myself using the different apps depending on the mood of the day. One day, I'm drawn to Quill. Who knows how I'll feel tomorrow. Perhaps I'll be drawn to Quill again. Perhaps Medium. Having this variety of choice is actually the best part about it. So, if you want to know which is best, get all three. That's the best option, in my opinion.

This is the biggest leap in artistic medium ever. For thousands of years, artists have been painting on surfaces, Tilt Brush comepletely changed the game forever. I hope more kids and artists can take advantage of this.
In short just a super experience! Go get it ;-)
Looks really good, easy to play with.

and yet the most expansive drawing app out there.

I just wanted a Google Blocks with more colors! Why do you "geniuses" have to make everything convoluted?
C'mon, who doesn't want to paint with a BUNCH of different tools in 3d without worrying about space and running out of supplies?

For professional or even real artists this isn't a serious tool... If that's what you're looking for then try something else. Don't buy it and then complain it's not the VR equivalent of Illustrator or Photoshop - this is still a VR concept and you're buying a shadow of what the technology will become in 5 years. Either you like that idea or you don't.

But... As a playbox for someone who has zero artistic talent (like me!) or to introduce kids to the concept of 3D space this is fantastic. and cracking fun. I just lost 2 hours in it without noticing and I'm the least artistic person in the world.

one_reviews_text: At first i saw the google portion so i thought it might  be incredible with all the tools... then after buying it it turns out to feel alot like a demo with very few tools and little functionality.  its more like an app you let your 5 yr old play with. It gets boring after a few min of it.   If you are looking for a real tool to use i would say "Medium" or "Schetchbox"  will give you a better art program.  Google tilt brush could have done better than this.  Honestly, we are all kind of disapointed even for paying for it on sale.
Great for all creative persons and those who want to become one.

review_title: Better than Quill, in some ways
one_reviews_text: At first I was skeptical that this app would be worth the money, since Quill is already free and a very good VR art app. However, Tilt Brush does some very cool things that Quill doesn't. For instance, Tilt Brush has several animated brushes (like a fire brush). There are pre-made environments and objects in Tilt Brush. There is one big thing that Tilt Brush is missing that Quill has: layers. This is actually a pretty big deal, in my opinion. The ability to have layers makes your work much easier and more flexible. Also, Quill has made the editing process simpler by taking better advantage of the touch controllers. To undo something you simply swipe back on the thumb stick. To delete something you simply move your controller over it and press B. Once you know how to do things like this in Quill it makes editing a breeze. Tilt Brush feels like a slower process, breaking your flow, by making you flip to the menu and hitting the undo button. Still, I think this program is worth the money and I'm glad Google brought it to Oculus! PS: Both Tilt Brush and Quill are missing an obvious feature: shared canvas! Allow multiple people to use the same art-space simultaneously!

review_title: Fun but Quill is more professional
one_reviews_text:
As a professional illustrator for my taste Quill has better tools which professionals need and more possibilities, like color manipulation (repainting the color of objects for example), layers and their management which is very important for me. As a painter and drawer I don't need 90% of the things Tilt Brush offers. 

Tilt Brush has nice effect brushes (seems to be the usp of tilt brush) and i like the way the shader engine works (drop shadows on objects which give a feel for volume, also lighting/shading on some brushes) but for my typical illustration work this isn't really necessary. Because it's not the effects who are important to make a work interessting. It's the concept and idea behind it and your own drawing and painting skills. Especially when you have seen those programmed effects a hundred times.

So for the price of 30$ I expected a bit more and I would have not bought Tilt brush if I had known this before. But for 15$ at the moment it's ok and I don't regret it. Perhaps future updates will bring better, more features and advanced tools. If you are a hobbyist and you like to play with effects, than it's a fun app and I think you won't regret it, too. Because besides the things I said, it's fun especially when they aren't important for you.

Quill vs. Tilt Brush is like Photoshop compared to MS Paint or Art Rage 4 (If you know this program.) But to be fair: At the moment both programs are more a field for easy going and fun experiementing and Quill needs improvements, too. When I have to paint for job, I use neither Quill nor Tilt because both won't do the job at the moment, so instead I use Photoshop.

This was way more intutive than Quill. But it lacks the features that are necessary for scene management. Layers and layer functions like duplicate, merge and flatten are desparately needed. 

I would also like to see the ability to export the scene to .fbx or .obj and maintain the texture effect of the brushes. Mainly the thick oil paint brushes. 

I spend hours in this all the time everyday! I just want layers.

It's good on the Vive in roomscale, but not to bad on the Rift thanks to the Touch controllers and easy moment with the buttons from a seated setup, some times even easier than the Vive actually. Just missing some multiuser mode or live viewer mode where you could watch and interact with an artist like beeing able to play Pictionary with one painting and a couple of guest watching and guessing what's to be painted.

I saw Jacksepticeye playing this in one of his VR videos and it looked stunning with the light colors and all the different brushes. And finally it is here for the Oculus Rift and the Touch controllers. Totally worth the money in my opinion

I'm rating this one star because of the anti-American sketch in the Sketchbook (sample sketches) showing a degraded Statue of Liberty attached to a conservative political slogan. Ugly political commentary has no place in a product designed to appeal to everybody, especially when opinions representing alternative or conservative points of view are banned. Shame on you Google! You're showing your bias,
